questions.clue: This famous Greek mathematician is known for his theorem about right triangles.
This series, defined by each term being the sum of the two preceding ones, is named after an Italian mathematician.
The existence of this largest known prime number remains an ongoing quest in mathematics.
Despite much study, this problem concerning the distribution of prime numbers remains unsolved.
Named after a French mathematician, this unsolved conjecture aims to categorize all even integers greater than 2.
This civilization is famous for developing cuneiform, one of the earliest writing systems.
Known for their pyramids and hieroglyphs, this civilization flourished along a famous river.
This Mesoamerican civilization built the magnificent city of Tikal and used a complex calendar system.
This ancient civilization, located in what is now Peru, is famous for its unique geoglyphs known as the Nazca Lines.
The Qin Dynasty, known for unifying China and creating the first version of the Great Wall, belonged to this larger civilization.
This spicy, red paste is a staple in Korean cooking, often used to make kimchi.
Hailing from Italy, this long, flat pasta is typically used in a Bolognese sauce.
A staple in Egyptian cuisine, this dish comprises fava beans, often paired with olive oil and spices.
This Japanese cooking technique involves battering and deep-frying seafood or vegetables.
Originating from Oman, 'shuwa' is a traditional dish made by marinating meat and slow-cooking it over several days.
questions.answer: Pork or lamb marinated and pit-cooked

questions.clue: This black and white flightless bird is native to Antarctica and known for its tuxedo-like appearance.
Native to Madagascar, this unique primate has large eyes adapted to nocturnal life in its rainforest habitat.
Capable of changing its color to match its surroundings in the forests of Yemen and Saudi Arabia, this reptile is a master of disguise.
Found in the freshwater rivers of South America, this notorious fish is known for its sharp teeth and voracious appetite.
In Australia, this monotreme lays eggs despite being a mammal and is known for its spiny coat and long tongue used for picking up ants.
This composer delivered the magical score for the 2001 film 'Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone'.
The eerie theme for the film 'Jaws', released in 1975, became instantly recognizable and was composed by this musician.
Maurice Jarre won an Oscar for his work on the 1962 historical epic film, 'Lawrence of Arabia'.
This Ennio Morricone score elevated Sergio Leone's 1966 'The Good, the Bad and the Ugly' to legendary status.
questions.answer: The Good, the Bad and the Ugly Theme

questions.clue: Written by Max Steiner, the sweeping score of this 1939 historical romance set in the American South includes 'Tara's Theme'.

final.clue: This state, the only one with a unicameral legislature, was admitted to the Union on March 1, 1867.
